title: A Scene on the Tohickon Creek: Autumn
marks: Signature and Date LL in red: [T. Moran 1868/-Op 33]
text: Born in England, Thomas Moran came to America with his family in 1844. Moran painted this landscape shortly after returning from a European tour during which he studied the work of celebrated British landscape artist J.M.W. Turner (1775-1851). This painting is number thirty-three of a suite of forty-two canvases that he produced between 1863-68 depicting scenes of rural Pennsylvania.
provenance:
Lawrence S. Toms.[1] (Kennedy Galleries, New York, New York by 1968); purchased by MIA in 1968.

[1] According to invoice from Kennedy Galleries.
creditline: The Frances E. Andrews Wilderness Fund, in memory of her mother Mary Hunt Andrews
